The sentence is a contract agreement between two companies - Corporation A and Company B - about a software product. Corporation A has agreed to pay Company B $10 million for an AI software which is required to be completed within 12 months. If unsuccessful by deadline, Company B will have to refund $5 million to Corporation A and will need to provide an additional 3 months of free development. However, there will be no penalties if the delay is justified due to unavoidable circumstances. This contract is based on California law and any disagreements will be resolved through binding arbitration.

This sentence represents a contractual agreement between Corporation A and Company B. However, this clause is not applicable if the delay is caused by factors outside of Company B's control. Any disputes that occur will be governed under California law and resolved via binding arbitration, making this arrangement formal, legally binding and enforceable.
